article_title: FCC Cracking Down on 911 Service Failures
article_text:
For three hours last August, almost all T-Mobile US Inc.’s about 50 million customers couldn’t reach 911.

The nationwide outage, disclosed on Friday, was at least the third major outage by a variety of telecom operators of the 911 call system in three years, raising concerns among federal regulators that the country’s emergency response system is becoming more vulnerable. The system has evolved away from local networks connected by...

twitter.description: After at least three major outages involving 911 emergency call systems in three years, the Federal Communications Commission is issuing substantial fines and taking steps to make phone companies develop better technology.
twitter.creator: @Ryan_Knutson

image.alt: FCC hits phone companies with fines, prods for better technology after 911 outages.

twitter.title: FCC Cracking Down on 911 Service Failures
